rcomplex 0.1.0
  • Reference

Compute co-expression network from an expression matrix

Source: R/network.R
compute_network.Rd

Calculates correlation, applies normalization (Mutual Rank or CLR), and determines a density-based co-expression threshold.

compute_network(
  expr_matrix,
  cor_method = c("pearson", "spearman"),
  norm_method = c("MR", "CLR"),
  density = 0.03,
  abs_cor = FALSE,
  mr_log_transform = FALSE,
  min_var = 0,
  n_cores = 1L
)

Arguments

expr_matrix

Numeric matrix of expression values (genes x samples). Row names must be gene identifiers.

cor_method

Correlation method: "pearson" (default) or "spearman".

norm_method

Normalization method: "MR" (Mutual Rank, default) or "CLR" (Context Likelihood Ratio).

density

Fraction of top edges to keep (default 0.03 = 3%).

abs_cor

If TRUE, take absolute value of correlations before normalization (default FALSE).

mr_log_transform

If FALSE (default), use the raw MR formula matching the original RComPlEx R Markdown. If TRUE, use Obayashi & Kinoshita (2009) log-normalized formula (values in [0,1]).

min_var

Minimum row variance threshold. Genes with variance below this value are removed before computing correlations. Default 0 removes only constant genes (zero variance). Set to a positive value (e.g. 1e-3) to also remove near-invariant genes that produce noisy correlations. Set to NULL to disable filtering entirely.

n_cores

Number of threads for parallel computation (default 1).

Value

A list with components:

network

Named symmetric matrix (genes x genes) with normalized co-expression values. Diagonal is set to 0.

threshold

The co-expression threshold at the given density.

n_genes

Number of genes in the network.

n_removed

Number of genes removed by variance filter (0 if min_var is NULL).

params

List of parameters used.

Contents
